intro: Toxocarpus brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed waxplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, often forming dense colonies. Its botanical features make it an important species for wetland ecosystems and ecological studies.
